titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against the bill (H.R. 4602) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1995, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-554, by Mr. Gordon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4602. All points of order against provisions of the bill for failure to comply with clause 2 or 6 of rule XXI are waived except on page 80, line 10 through line 19. Measure will be read by paragraph. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 175.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/21/1994--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 4602 (making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for FY 1995).
